meanings.sent1: Her delusion that she could fly led to dangerous situations.
meanings.sent2: His delusion about being a superhero made him wear a cape everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The delusion that cats can talk made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The delusion of invincibility shattered when he fell off his bike.
meanings.sent5: The delusion that the moon was made of cheese fascinated the young astronomer.

meanings.definition: The act of deluding or the state of being deluded
meanings.sent1: The magician's delusion amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The delusion of grandeur clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent3: The delusion of winning the lottery brought a smile to his face.
meanings.sent4: The delusion of invisibility vanished when he bumped into a wall.
meanings.sent5: The delusion of being a secret agent thrilled the imaginative child.

meanings.definition: A persistent false psychotic belief regarding the self or persons or objects outside the self
meanings.sent1: His delusion that aliens were watching him made him paranoid.
meanings.sent2: The delusion of being followed haunted her every step.
meanings.sent3: The delusion that his cat was a spy amused his friends.
meanings.sent4: The delusion of being a time traveler consumed his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The delusion that the mirror showed a different person terrified him.
